page.title: 01Badcall Bay Sutherland
page.content: Unlike Eddrachelles Bay, Badcall Bay contains many small uninhabited islands. These islands are fairly rocky; the coastline is even rockier, with only a few smooth bays. The land here is very boggy and marshy and is not farmed. The village, Upper Badcall extends for about half a mile along a twisty single track unclassified road. In the village there is a telephone but no post office. However a moblile bank and shop does visit the village every week. Just outside the are, in the bay there are sea cages in which salmon are matured. They are hatched at a hatchery at Duartmore Bridge. There is no permanent shop, school or church in the area.
